etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in James Ewart (?1791–1823). From Afrikaans melkhout and its etymon South African Dutch melkhout from Dutch melk + hout wood

definitions: Any of several trees of the family Sapotaceae with milky sap; especially (a) (more fully "white melkhout") the white milkwood, Sideroxylon inerme; the pale timber of this tree; (b) (more fully "red melkhout") the red milkwood, Mimusops obovata.
